a_t01_i01_tv01:
“Hoje em ‘Cidadventures’, veremos Mesagoza,
uma cidade que abriga uma conhecida academia...”\r
Ooopa! É melhor ir andando!
a_t01_i01_tv02:
“Venha para Every Wich Way! Temos todo tipo 
de sanduíches, do jeito que você preferir!”\c
“Nossos sanduíches são preparados à mão por
profissionais e perfeitos para piqueniques!”
a_t01_i01_01:
Sua bolsa e seu chapéu estão pendurados aqui. 
Mas ainda é muito cedo para se arrumar para ir!
a_t01_i01_02:
Este é o seu guarda-roupa, enfeitado 
com vários adesivos de Pokémons.
a_t01_i01_03:
Esta é a sua cama macia e fofinha.
Tem um cheiro adorável e aquecido pelo sol!
a_t01_i01_04:
É um Skwovet de pelúcia, feito com um 
material suave e de boa qualidade.
a_t01_i01_05:
É o novo Nintendo Switch! 
Este aqui tem uma tela maior!
a_t01_i01_06:
É um mapa da região de Paldea.
Sua casa fica na costa ao sul!
a_t01_i01_07:
Um par de prateleiras feitas pela sua mãe.
São perfeitas para organizar seus pertences.
a_t01_i01_08:
Esta janela tem vista para o quintal dos fundos,
e também para o mar que se estende atrás dele!
a_t01_i01_09:
Um quadro intitulado “A Mulher que se Alonga”.
Evoca um sentimento indescritível!
a_t01_i01_10:
Um quadro intitulado “Os moinhos e o céu”.
Sinta a brisa fresca acariciando seu rosto!
a_t01_i01_11:
É uma das plantas de casa de sua mãe. Tome 
cuidado para não esbarrar e derrubá-la!
a_t01_i01_12:
Um quadro intitulado “Antes do Suco”.
Isso parece tão refrescante!
a_t01_i01_13:
Um quadro intitulado “A Luz do Corte e da Cola”.
São vários papéis coloridos colados juntos!
a_t01_i01_14:
Esse é o quarto da sua mãe! 
É melhor não entrar aí sem pedir.
a_t01_i01_15:
Um vaso grande com uma grande planta.
Também há pequenas flores florescendo!
a_t01_i01_16:
Essas pequenas caixas de papelão pesam uma 
tonelada. O que será que tem dentro delas?
a_t01_i01_17:
Um quadro intitulado “Ruas do meio-dia”.
Ele retrata uma bela cidade de outra região.
a_t01_i01_18:
Há um kit de primeiros socorros, um brinquedo e
algo a mais, mas é muito alto para você alcançar.
a_t01_i01_19:
Do outro lado desta porta está o depósito.
É melhor não tentar entrar aí.
a_t01_i01_20:
A cama onde o Skwovet da família dorme.
Está cheia de manchas de baba.
a_t01_i01_21:
O quintal dos fundos está repleto de flores
desabrochando!
a_t01_i01_22:
Mamãe comprou esta geladeira quando vocês se
mudaram. Está cheia de ingredientes de lanches!
a_t01_i01_23:
É um fogão de indução. Você deve pedir 
a ajuda de sua mãe caso queira usá-lo.
a_t01_i01_24:
É uma linda e enorme pia dupla que
é sempre mantida limpa e brilhante.
a_t01_i01_25:
Esta porta conduz até à horta da casa.
É melhor você ir pela porta da frente!
a_t01_i01_26:
Uma fruteira cheia de frutas suculentas e
maduras!
a_t01_i02_01:
Um quadro intitulado “Amor Fraterno”.
É muito charmoso!
a_t01_i02_02:
Um quadro intitulado “Mares cintilantes”.
É de encher os olhos!
a_t01_i02_03:
Um quadro intitulado “O Ninja Oculto”.
Isso deveria ser um Pokémon?
a_t01_i02_04: Você pode ver a praia entre as cortinas!
a_t01_i02_05:
É uma geladeira de última geração! Mas não 
vamos sair por aí abrindo as coisas dos outros.
a_t01_i02_06:
Os pratos neste armário foram incrivelmente
bem empilhados!
bg_vending_snack_01:
É uma máquina de venda automática abastecida
com todos os tipos de lanches!
a_sch_entrance01_book_01_00:
Há um livro intitulado "Galar: Uma História".
Você quer lê-lo?
a_sch_entrance01_book_01_01:
Fomos para a cidade de Stow-on-Side, que fica
escondida nas montanhas, para estudar um antigo
mural pintado em uma parede de pedra. Mas
nossos planos — e o próprio mural — foram
destruídos por um ataque de um Copperajah!
a_sch_entrance01_book_01_02:
No entanto, por trás do mural, o que poderíamos
encontrar senão um par de estátuas de Pokémon — 
uma com uma espada e a outra com um escudo!
Essas estátuas, mais velhas do que qualquer artefato
que já havíamos descoberto, questionavam tudo o
que sabíamos sobre o herói lendário.
a_sch_entrance01_book_02_00:
Há um livro intitulado "Festivais de Paldea."
Você quer lê-lo?
a_sch_entrance01_book_02_01:
A cidade paldeana de Cortondo, amplamente conhecida
por sua produção de azeitonas, também abriga o peculiar
Festival da Colheita da Azeitona. Os participantes tentam
inaugurar uma abundante colheita de azeitonas rolando
grandes bolas que assemelham-se a azeitonas em um gol.
a_sch_entrance01_book_02_02:
Diz-se que quanto mais bolas de azeitona forem
roladas para o gol, mais abundante será a colheita
do próximo ano. Todos os visitantes, incluindo turistas,
são bem-vindos a participar do Rolo de Azeitona- então,
leitor, experimente se estiver na cidade para o festival!
a_sch_entrance01_book_03_00:
Existe um livro intitulado “Apreciando a Sunflora”.
Você quer ler?
a_sch_entrance01_book_03_01:
Em Artazon, uma cidade viva com flores e obras de
arte, há um amor especial e duradouro pelo Sol
Pokémon Sunflora, cuja figura ensolarada e floral e
sorriso brilhante nunca deixa de aquecer o coração.
a_sch_entrance01_book_03_02:
Os habitantes de Artazon há muito reverenciam
a natureza — o tema de muita arte feita na cidade — 
e o sol estimulante. Sunflora incorpora as qualidades
de ambos, e é por isso que a cidade tem a tradição de
coletar e cuidar desses Pokémon.
a_sch_entrance01_book_04_00a:
Há um livro chamado “A Canção da Academia
Laranja". Você quer ler?
a_sch_entrance01_book_04_01a:
Sobre a grande Mesagoza ergue-se nossa querida Laranja,
Onde entramos como sementes e saímos em fruição,
Nossas mentes amplas como a cratera, para sábios educadores
Para encher de força, grandeza e tradição. Ensine-nos bem, ó
laranjas de Paldea!
a_sch_entrance01_book_04_00b:
Há um livro chamado “A Canção da Academia
Uva". Você quer ler?
a_sch_entrance01_book_04_01b:
Sobre a grande Mesagoza ergue-se nossa querida Uva,
Onde entramos como sementes e saímos em fruição,
Nossas mentes amplas como a cratera, para sábios
educadores Para preencher com espírito individual e
ambição futura. Ensine-nos bem, ó uvas de Paldea!
a_sch_entrance01_book_05_00:
Existe um livro intitulado “Como se tornar um
Campeão." Você quer ler?
a_sch_entrance01_book_05_01:
Para Pokémon Trainers que querem ficar mais fortes
e mais sábios, não há nada melhor do que se tornar um
Campeão! Para alcançar esse posto elevado, você deve
passar por um teste administrado na sede oficial da Liga
Pokémon de Paldea.
a_sch_entrance01_book_05_02:
Em Paldea, qualquer um — e, na verdade, qualquer
número de pessoas — pode se tornar um Campeão, 
independentemente de fatores como idade. Isso
significa que também pode, desde que tenha força e
sabedoria para dar um exemplo de liderança
para seus colegas Treinadores!
a_sch_entrance01_book_05_03:
Seu caminho para se tornar um Campeão está no
Ginásios Pokémon em Paldea. Depois de derrotar os
oito Líderes de Ginásio em batalha e ganhar suas
Insígnias de Ginásio, esperamos que bata à porta da
Liga Pokémon.
a_sch_entrance01_book_06_00:
Há uma revista intitulada “Esportes Paldeanos
Mensal”. Você quer ler?
a_sch_entrance01_book_06_01:
O triturador Sub-zero fez isso de novo! o o segundo
snowboarder do mundo fez um clínica na Copa
Montenevera, conquistando sua sexta vitória
consecutiva nas principais competições do Paldea.
Não ha ninguém já conseguiu arrebatar aquela coroa!
a_sch_entrance01_book_06_02:
“If you think you’ve got what it takes, come take
me on!” this ice-cold athlete declared from the
winners’ podium, and you could just feel his rivals
steel their resolve! We’ll see how things unfold
in two weeks at the Glaseado Mountain Cup!
a_sch_entrance01_book_07_00:
There’s a book entitled “Academy Rules and
Regulations.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_07_01:
DRESS:	Students shall wear their academy-
	provided uniforms at all times.
HAIR:	Hairstyle is left to students’ discretion.
OTHER:	Students should behave properly and
	strive not to inconvenience others.
a_sch_entrance01_book_07_02:
ADDENDUM:
During their independent study, students may
travel freely throughout the Paldea region.
However, the [clr:6]Great Crater of Paldea[clr:0] remains
[clr:6]strictly off-limits[clr:0] due to safety hazards.
a_sch_entrance01_book_08_00:
There’s a magazine entitled “Sweet Truth!”
Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_08_01:
This tasty pastry wonder is undergoing a
popularity sugar rush that’s got lines out the
door all day long! It’s Patisserie Soapberry,
located in Cortondo—olive central—at the foot
of a very large tree!
a_sch_entrance01_book_08_02:
At the heart of it all is Katy, the proprietor, who
inherited the shop from family and keeps its
ovens hard at work! Soapberry’s Bug-type
Pokémon theme is on full display in its pastry
lineup—they’re a treat to see and to eat!
a_sch_entrance01_book_09_00:
There’s a magazine entitled “The Musician’s
Register.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_09_01:
Four decades into her career, Ryme—the “MC of
RIP,” whose flows are said to bring the dead to
their feet—maintains her huge following and her
rap legend status. The theme of death pervades
her work—and not just because her bars slay.
a_sch_entrance01_book_09_02:
When Ryme was in her teens, her dear Puppy
Pokémon passed away, and she poured her grief
into a song. When she sang it, her partner came
back to her as a ghost Pokémon. In that moment,
the rapper we know today was born.
a_sch_entrance01_book_10_00:
There’s a magazine entitled “Art: The Scenic
Route.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_10_01:
This month, we’re taking the scenic route over
to Artazon to see Surrendering Sunflora by
Brassius, the Verdant Virtuoso. This humble
columnist wonders if ever a work has so aptly
captured ennui and languor as this installation.
a_sch_entrance01_book_10_02:
The sculptures are every bit as surreal as the title,
prompting great minds to debate just what has
sent these Sunflora into a state of surrender. But
though the meaning may elude us, the reader is
urged to visit Artazon and see for themselves.
a_sch_entrance01_book_11_00:
There’s a pamphlet entitled “Hall of Fame
Badges: A Record.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_11_title: Hall of Fame Badges: A Record
a_sch_entrance01_book_11_01:
Our academy honors students and graduates
that achieve outstanding results, no matter the
field, with a Hall of Fame Badge. We hope
students will be encouraged to follow their
passions, wherever they may lead.
a_sch_entrance01_book_11_02a_clear:
Hall of Fame Badge Awardees

Sada	.........	.........
.........	.........	Nemona
Arven	Penny	[trnm:0]
a_sch_entrance01_book_11_02b_clear:
Hall of Fame Badge Awardees

Turo	.........	.........
.........	.........	Nemona
Arven	Penny	[trnm:0]
a_sch_entrance01_book_12_00:
There’s a book entitled “Status Conditions and
Catching Pokémon.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_12_01:
Dealing damage to a wild Pokémon makes it
easier to catch in a Poké Ball, and inflicting
status conditions on the Pokémon can make it
easier still.
a_sch_entrance01_book_12_02:
Certain status conditions will provide even better
odds of a successful catch than others. Putting a
Pokémon to sleep or freezing it, for example,
may yield better results than inflicting poison,
paralysis, or a burn.
a_sch_entrance01_book_13_00:
There’s a book entitled “Types and Moves I.”
Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_13_01:
You may be familiar with Pokémon that are
Grass, Fire, or Water type. There are eighteen
such types in all, and every Pokémon species has
at least one type—some have two.
a_sch_entrance01_book_13_02:
When Pokémon use a move that is the same type
as they are, that move’s power is increased by
50 percent. For Pokémon that have two types,
moves of either type will receive this increase.
a_sch_entrance01_book_14_00:
There’s a book entitled “Types and Moves II.”
Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_14_01:
When Pokémon Terastallize, their type becomes
their [clr:6]Tera Type[clr:0]. That means moves of their Tera
Type will have their power increased. Moves of
the Pokémon’s original type will keep their usual
power increase as well.
a_sch_entrance01_book_14_02:
For example, if a Pikachu—which is innately
Electric type—has Steel as its Tera Type, then
upon Terastallizing it would receive boosts in
power for both the Steel-type move Iron Tail
and the Electric-type move Thunderbolt.
a_sch_entrance01_book_15_00:
There’s a book entitled “Pokémon Natures.”
Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_15_01:
Individual Pokémon have different Natures, much
as people do. You may be able to get an idea of
your Pokémon’s Natures if you watch how they
behave on picnics—whether they run around a
lot or nap a lot, for example.
a_sch_entrance01_book_15_02:
Pokémon’s Natures influence their stats to a
degree. For example, Pokémon with Adamant
Natures tend to have their Attack stat grow
stronger than it would otherwise, while their
Sp. Atk stat may suffer.
a_sch_entrance01_book_16_00:
There’s a book entitled “Fine Foods from Far
Away.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_16_01:
Have you chanced upon Pewter Crunchies, the
fabled signature dish of the Kanto region’s
Pewter City? These snacks’ rugged, browned
appearance makes them almost rock-like at
first glance.
a_sch_entrance01_book_16_02:
Indeed, Pewter Crunchies were inspired by the
Rock-type Pokémon for which the Pewter Gym is
renowned. Unfortunately, their forbiddingly
tough appearance and surprisingly thin flavor
have kept them from attaining true popularity.
a_sch_entrance01_book_17_00:
There’s a book entitled “Charcadet’s
Adventures.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_17_01:
Charcadet, the Fire Child Pokémon, may have
been little, but did that stop it from being a
mighty hero? Not one bit! When a mean Gengar
came along to play tricks and scare people,
Charcadet stood tall! “Raaah! Hi-YAH!” it cried!
a_sch_entrance01_book_17_02:
But soon, brave little Charcadet got bound up
tight in Gengar’s looong tongue! How could the
Fire Child Pokémon get out of this mess?
Just as things started to grow hazy before
Charcadet’s eyes, the sound of a voice came...
a_sch_entrance01_book_17_03:
“Two paths lie before you, young Charcadet,”
it said. “Choose between these two sets of armor
and assume a new form so you can defeat
Gengar!” And sure enough, two sets of armor
appeared before Charcadet... (To be continued)
a_sch_entrance01_book_18_00:
There’s a book entitled “Of People and
Pokémon.” Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_18_01:
Far in the past, humankind and Pokémon lived
in mutual fear of one another. But some humans
who loved and appreciated Pokémon made an
effort to bridge this divide, and gradually, the
two sides grew closer and found harmony.
a_sch_entrance01_book_19_00:
There’s a book entitled “Student Registry.”
Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_book_19_01:
This thick book holds a thorough record of the
academy’s students and when they attended!
a_sch_entrance01_book_19_02:
Wait, what’s this? Some of the recent pages have
parts torn out, so you can’t read them!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_01_01:
There’s a magazine entitled “Occulture.” It’s the
September issue. Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_01_02a:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #09
Great Tusk: A Living Relic of the Dinosaur Era?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_01_03a:
In one arid corner of Paldea, there have been
reports of a mysterious life-form. It’s said to
resemble a Donphan at first glance, albeit one
with gigantic tusks, tough scales, and an
aggressive disposition.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_01_04a:
Leading theories hold that this being is nothing
less than a living relic of the dinosaur era, but
no one can say for sure. Apparently, it’s called
Great Tusk after the name of a strange being that
was written about in the mysterious Scarlet Book.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_01_02b:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #09
Iron Treads: An Alien Weapon?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_01_03b:
In one arid corner of Paldea, there have been
reports of a mysterious life-form. It’s said to
resemble a Donphan at first glance, albeit one
that can abruptly assume a spherical shape and
launch into a swift rolling attack.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_01_04b:
Rumors say this being is some kind of weapon
using technology not of this world, but no one
can say for sure. Apparently, it’s called Iron
Treads after the name of a strange being that was
written about in the mysterious Violet Book.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_02_01:
There’s a magazine entitled “Occulture.” It’s the
October issue. Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_02_02a:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #10
Scream Tail: A Billion-Year-Old Jigglypuff?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_02_03a:
Somewhere in a Paldean forest, it’s said, lurks
Scream Tail—a being with Jigglypuff’s own
endearing puffball appearance but also a
ferocious aggression that leads it to attack
anyone who comes near.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_02_04a:
Its primitive appearance and savage nature have
prompted rumors that it could be a Jigglypuff
from one billion years ago. It’s named after a
creature in the Scarlet Book that is described as
having a distinctive tail and scream.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_02_02b:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #10
Iron Bundle: An Ancient Civilization’s Robot?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_02_03b:
The mysterious Violet Book makes reference to a
being called Iron Bundle, which was said to look
like Delibird and to possess a spherical apparatus
from which it would fire huge blasts of ice to
propel itself through snowy lands.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_02_04b:
Plenty of theories about it have been floated. A
leading one suggests it is the product of a long-
gone civilization—a notion supported by ancient
writings that describe the design and usage of
machines resembling Iron Bundle.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_03_01:
There’s a magazine entitled “Occulture.” It’s the
August issue. Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_03_02a:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #08
Slither Wing: A Prehistoric Volcarona, Revived?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_03_03a:
There have been precious few sightings reported
of the ultra-mysterious Slither Wing, a being
whose name is taken from that of a similar-
seeming creature described in the ever-puzzling
Scarlet Book.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_03_04a:
Slither Wing shares traits with Volcarona, so some
theorize that it may have been revived from
fossils from a prehistoric era that we have
discussed in these pages. However, no Volcarona
fossils of that era are known to have been found.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_03_02b:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #08
Iron Moth: A UFO Sent to Spy on Humankind?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_03_03b:
The name Iron Moth was borrowed from that of a
flying object described in the era-defining Violet
Book. It was said to resemble Volcarona and
would descend from the skies, following people
around and occasionally even attacking them.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_03_04b:
Some point to Iron Moth’s aggression as a sign
that it is, in fact, a UFO of sorts being controlled
by alien life. Perhaps something out there is using
Iron Moth to observe us, waiting for the moment
to mount an invasion...
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_04_01:
There’s a magazine entitled “Occulture.” It’s the
July issue. Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_04_02a:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #07
Sandy Shocks: A Magneton with a 10-Thousand-
Year Lifespan?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_04_03a:
Some scientists claim that this mysterious being is
a Magneton that has lived for 10 thousand years.
It has been sighted numerous times in Paldea’s
more arid regions, but there are no reports of it
ever having been caught.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_04_04a:
It’s said that Sandy Shocks is an aggressive sort
and that some people who’ve seen it have been
attacked as well. It takes its name from a beast
with a matching description in the era-defining
Scarlet Book.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_04_02b:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #07
Iron Jugulis: Pokémon or Machine?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_04_03b:
This flying life-form bearing a resemblance to
Hydreigon has been seen in a certain corner of
Paldea. It was reported to have razed an entire
building with a high-energy blast, then flown off
as if to find its next objective.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_04_04b:
Iron Jugulis is theorized to be a sort of machine-
Hydreigon hybrid, as it combines the former’s
ruthlessness with the latter’s ferocity. It takes
its name from a similarly described entity in
the Violet Book.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_05_01:
There’s a magazine entitled “Occulture.” It’s the
June issue. Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_05_02a:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #06
Brute Bonnet: Amoonguss Meets Dinosaur?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_05_03a:
This bizarre creature is said to combine traits of
dinosaurs with those of the Pokémon Amoonguss.
It’s named after a fierce mushroom creature of
matching description that appears in the
renowned Scarlet Book.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_05_04a:
Brute Bonnet certainly resembles Amoonguss,
though with its own unique twists: its gigantic
stature and seemingly low intelligence combine
to make it a savage, powerful fighter.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_05_02b:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #06
Iron Thorns: A Tyranitar of the Distant Future?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_05_03b:
A strange being called Iron Thorns has been
sighted in a certain cave in Paldea. This being
bears a strong resemblance to Tyranitar, but it
apparently displays great coolheadedness and
prefers to avoid unnecessary fights.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_05_04b:
It appears to be highly intelligent and clad in
metallic armor, causing some to speculate that it
may be a Tyranitar as it would appear a billion
years from now. Its name comes from a similarly
described entity that appears in the Violet Book.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_06_01:
There’s a magazine entitled “Occulture.” It’s the
May issue. Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_06_02a:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #05
Flutter Mane: A Ghostly Pterosaur?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_06_03a:
Flutter Mane—a name taken from a strange
creature with a matching description appearing in
the Scarlet Book—is said to float around the sky
at night with its long hair writhing about it.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_06_04a:
Eyewitness accounts describe it as resembling a
giant Misdreavus at first glance, albeit a highly
fierce and aggressive one. Some believe that it’s
a ghost of a pterosaur from a long-gone era.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_06_02b:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #05
Iron Hands: Secretly a Cyborg?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_06_03b:
This being’s name comes from the one given to
an iron-handed entity in the mysterious Violet
Book. It is said to have fists that move
independent of its body and to be capable of
throwing large, fast-moving vehicles.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_06_04b:
A leading theory holds that Iron Hands was once
an athlete who became mortally wounded but
was kept alive by being made into a cyborg.
Why it so strongly resembles Hariyama, however,
remains unanswered.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_07_01:
There’s a magazine entitled “Occulture.” It’s the
April issue. Do you want to read it?
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_07_02a:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #04
Roaring Moon: A Primeval Salamence?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_07_03a:
This elusive creature is called Roaring Moon after
a similarly described being in the Scarlet Book. It
looks similar to Salamence when they undergo a
certain phenomenon elsewhere in the world, but
it’s unclear if there is any connection.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_07_04a:
This creature scatters feathers as it flies around at
high speeds seeking prey. It’s thought to be more
savage than Salamence, and if you should
encounter one, it’s imperative that you avoid
actual contact.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_07_02b:
Enigmas of Paldea, File #04
Iron Valiant: An Experiment Gone Wrong?!
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_07_03b:
This oddity’s name is borrowed from that of an
object described in the Violet Book. One theory
holds that it is in fact a robot—the product of a
mad scientist’s efforts to create the most
powerful psychic Pokémon of all.
a_sch_entrance01_ocalture_07_04b:
According to its few eyewitnesses, Iron Valiant
appears similar to both Gardevoir and Gallade.
It’s also said to be cruel enough to take its
brilliantly shining blade and cut down anyone
confronting it without hesitation.
a_xxx_g01_01: The rack is full of magazines about Pokémon!
a_xxx_g01_02:
The poster says, “Are your Pokémon hurting?
Hurry down to the Pokémon Center!”
a_xxx_g01_03:
It’s an old cartoon about Gorgin’ Greedent and
all the mischief he stirs up!
t04_01:
Surrendering Sunflora
A work by Brassius
t04_02:
The Harvest
A work by Brassius
t04_03:
Meditative Seat
A work by an unknown artist
t04_04:
Blossoming Infinity
A work by an unknown artist
t04_05:
Heterarchical Loop
A work by an unknown artist
t04_06:
Paradoxical Popper
A work by an unknown artist
a_w01_i01_01:
It’s a sink that hasn’t been used in a while.
The mirror’s fogged and hard to see in.
a_w01_i01_03:
The shelf holds seasonings that are past their
expiration dates.
a_w01_i01_04:
The cooktop shows signs of having been
used recently!
a_w01_i01_05:
It’s a microwave. Looks like it hasn’t been used
in a long while.
a_w01_i01_06: The fridge’s door is too heavy to open.
a_w01_i01_07:
There are picture books for kids. One of them
tells a story about making a big sandwich!
a_w01_i01_08: There’s no photo in this frame.
a_w01_i01_09: It’s full of old, tough-to-understand books.
a_w01_i01_10:
The whiteboard is a mess of scribbled letters
and numbers.
a_w01_i01_11:
It’s a bed for a Pokémon. “Maschiff” is written
on it in a kid’s handwriting!
a_w01_i01_12:
All sorts of research data is displayed on the
monitors!
a_w01_i01_13: It’s a mysterious device! Better not touch it.
a_w23_i01_01:
Whatever these mysterious machines are, they
seem to be constantly running calculations.
a_w23_i01_02:
The shutter on this side doesn’t seem like it’ll
open. Perhaps it’s broken.
a_w23_i02_01:
There are lots of containers here, but it’s not
clear what they’re for.
a_w23_i01_04:
This is one big container! It looks like, at some
point, it used to...move?
a_w23_i11_01:
We’ve determined that this energy crystallization
is linked to the being we call ▉▉▉▉▉▉.\c
The interlocking hexagonal plates that comprise
▉▉▉▉▉▉’s shell must somehow cause this\r
phenomenon—which I’ve dubbed “Terastallizing.”
a_w23_i11_02:
Thanks to my prototype Tera Orb, I secured
corporate funding for my research and made\r
a laboratory in the lighthouse near Cabo Poco.\c
Someday, though, I’ll return to the crater and
resume my study of these crystals.
a_w23_i12_01:
At last I can resume work on the Tera Project!\c
I’ll move my research to the Zero Lab this month.
My team will be smaller, but no matter.\c
The strong influence of the crystals makes our
experiments much more unstable.
a_w23_i12_02:
The crystals’ power is tremendous! Their unstable
output made our corporate backers fret, but...\c
If we can harness this energy, it will open up
research possibilities we’d only dreamed of.\c
At last, paradise will be ours to create.
a_w23_i13_01a:
Our time machine research has yielded a
triumph—a Pokémon from the ancient past!\c
I’ve named it Koraidon.\c
I was expecting one new life to treasure, but
what fortune to be blessed with this gift as well!
a_w23_i13_01b:
Our time machine research has yielded a
triumph—a Pokémon from the distant future!\c
I’ve named it Miraidon.\c
I was expecting one new life to treasure, but
what fortune to be blessed with this gift as well!
a_w23_i13_02a:
I’ve successfully brought more and more ancient
Pokémon to our time since the first one.\c
I’m so close to creating a world like the one in
the book—a paradise where we three can live\r
happily together forever. I must make it real.
a_w23_i13_02b:
I’ve successfully brought more and more future
Pokémon to our time since the first one.\c
I’m so close to creating a world like the one in
the book—a paradise where we three can live\r
happily together forever. I must make it real.
a_w23_i14_01a:
I need more people. More time. That man walked
out not long after the boy was born.\c
I need another set of hands, but could they
be trusted? And how long would it take them to\r
even understand? If only there were two of me.
a_w23_i14_01b:
I need more people. More time. That woman
walked out not long after the boy was born.\c
I need another set of hands, but could they
be trusted? And how long would it take them to\r
even understand? If only there were two of me.
a_w23_i14_02a:
My new assistant has intellect and technical skills
to rival my own.\c
A bit rigid at times, but I’ve got no serious
complaints. Productivity has doubled.\c
We even brought in a second Koraidon via the
machine—though this one has proved aggressive.
a_w23_i14_02b:
My new assistant has intellect and technical skills
to rival my own.\c
A bit rigid at times, but I’ve got no serious
complaints. Productivity has doubled.\c
We even brought in a second Miraidon via the
machine—though this one has proved aggressive.
a_w23_i11_14_01:
You’ve already disabled the lock from
this station!
a_w23_i11_14_02: The door seems broken. It won’t work...
a_w23_i14_03:
A huge pipe is lying on the ground. It’s been
crushed and dented in various places.
a_w23_i14_04:
These crystals seem to be eating into the
research station...
a_w23_i14_05:
A large gas canister has fallen over. It must
have been used for something.
a_w23_i21_01:
A microscope and various samples have been
left here.
a_w23_i21_02:
Confusing equations and phrases are scribbled
all over this whiteboard.
a_w23_i21_03:
You can see a strange, rocklike clump of
something inside this machine.
a_w23_i21_04:
Various research documents are scattered on
the desk.
a_w23_i21_05:
Hang on, there’s something written here...\c
“In order to better defend the Zero Lab, I have
developed what I call the Poké Ball Lock System.\c
“Once it has identified IDs associated with
specific Poké Balls, it can...”\c
The rest of it is too faded to make out.
a_w23_i21_06:
It’s a picture of a young boy and a Maschiff.
They look really friendly with each other!
t05_01:
It’s a picture stand with face cutouts so you can
pretend to be a Pokémon!
t08_01:
Look at these huge speakers! Bass notes from
these must vibrate through the whole town!
t09_01:
It’s a big coal-fired kiln! Looks like people use it
to bake clay into cookware.
c02_01:
It’s Cascarrafa’s signature fountain! You can feel
a cool spray from the water!
c03_00:
This sculpture is polished to a bright gleam!
Is it supposed to represent a building?
t01_02:
É um pequeno depósito atrás da cozinha!
Há pás, fertilizante e outras coisas dentro dele.
t01_03:
É uma torneira exclusiva para o jardim!
É melhor não usá-la a torto e a direito.
t01_04:
Esta porta conduz até à cozinha. Se você quiser 
entrar,  é melhor ir pela porta da frente!
t01_05:
A sheet and one of your mom’s aprons are
fluttering peacefully in the breeze!
t01_06:
The Pokémon-shaped fountain is merrily
spraying water!
a_sch_room_common:
It’s one of the big, high-tech display panels that
the teachers use in class!
a_sch_room03_01:
These cabinets hold lots of lab equipment for
doing different kinds of experiments!
a_sch_room03_02:
These must be lab coats for when it’s time to do
experiments...
a_sch_room03_03:
The biology lab faucets have little hoses attached
to them for some reason!
a_sch_room03_04:
It’s a model of a coastal area! It looks useful for
understanding Pokémon ecology!
a_sch_room02_01:
Maybe these fruits and flowers are meant to be
used for still-life painting?
a_sch_room02_02: This must be a sculpture of a Balloon Pokémon!
a_sch_room02_03:
Plenty of artwork by students is hung on the
walls. It’s all bursting with personality!
a_sch_room02_04:
This Pokémon sculpture looks like it might start
flapping its wings at any moment!
a_sch_room01_01:
Lots of gleaming white dishes are stacked up in
this cabinet!
a_sch_room01_02:
There’s a pair of wide sinks! Four people could
probably wash dishes here at the same time!
a_sch_room01_03: This microwave has seen plenty of use!
a_sch_room01_04:
These fridges are for students to use however
they see fit!
a_sch_room01_05: This bookcase is full of cookbooks!
a_sch_room01_06:
That’s one big pot! It could probably make
enough food to serve plenty of people.
a_sch_office02_01:
It’s a printer! No, wait—is this a photocopier...?
Or maybe a scanner? Maybe it’s all three...
a_sch_office02_02:
There are some very grown-up-looking jackets
hung up on this clothes rack!
a_sch_office02_03:
Lots of different books and folders are placed
haphazardly on the shelves!
a_sch_office02_04:
This whiteboard has the teachers’ schedules
written out on it. They’re all so busy!
a_sch_cafe01_01:
The menu’s written here! Looks like the staff
recommend the Potato Salad Sandwich!
a_sch_cafe01_02:
It’s a big industrial fridge. It’s got precise
temperature controls!
a_sch_cafe01_03:
These are induction cooktops! If you got a pot
going on one of these, you’d feel like a true chef!
a_sch_cafe01_04:
These microwaves have some food mess in them
from being used by so many students!
a_sch_cafe01_05: The sinks contain dishes waiting to get washed!
a_sch_cafe01_06:
This seems like a buffet table! But it’s not clear if
you can just take all you want or what...
a_sch_shop01_01: These shiny new Poké Balls are ₽200 each!
a_sch_shop01_02:
There are lots of handy items for taking care of
your Pokémon!
a_sch_shop01_03:
This shelf has notebooks, writing implements,
and other things to use in class!
a_sch_shop01_04: There are lots of magazines about Pokémon!
a_sch_shop01_05:
All this tasty-looking bread gives off fresh,
delicious smells that waft throughout the room.
a_sch_office03_01:
These drawers are full of spare clothes in lots of
different sizes!
a_sch_office03_02:
It’s full of books on health—both about people
and about Pokémon!
a_sch_office03_03:
It’s important to wash your hands carefully when
you come in from outside!
a_sch_office03_04:
This cabinet contains lots of medicines with
hard-to-pronounce names!
a_sch_office03_05:
It’s a bed for small- or medium-sized Pokémon
to snooze in!
a_sch_office03_06:
It’s a scale that can handle small- or medium-
sized Pokémon!
a_sch_dorm01_02:
It’s your study desk! It’s got plenty of handy
space to put things to the side, too.
a_sch_dorm01_03:
O banheiro está do outro lado dessa porta.
Certifique-se de mantê-lo limpo e arrumado!
a_sch_dorm01_04:
It’s a photo of you and your treasured friends to
remember your journeys by!
a_sch_dorm02_01:
These dietary supplements look like they were
chosen carefully to give Pokémon balanced diets!
a_sch_dorm02_02:
Nemona’s Gym Badges are squeaky-clean!
There’s a plaque with a shield, too!
a_sch_dorm02_03: A meticulous training schedule is written out here!
a_sch_dorm02_04: The bedspread has a battle court pattern!
a_sch_dorm03_01: Look at all these fresh ingredients!
a_sch_dorm03_02: This kitchen is clearly used with great care!
a_sch_dorm03_05: It’s a framed picture of a Maschiff!
a_sch_dorm03_06:
It’s a Pokémon bed! It looks a bit small for
Mabosstiff to fit in...
a_sch_dorm03_07:
It’s a map of Paldea! There are notes stuck to it
about places Arven’s investigated.
a_sch_dorm03_08: The bedspread is a bright, cheery color!
a_sch_dorm04_01:
There are tons of cardboard boxes from buying
things online!
a_sch_dorm04_02:
Empty boxes of instant foods are scattered
around the kitchen!
a_sch_dorm04_03: Pokémon figurines are lined up neatly here!
a_sch_dorm04_04: There’s a lot of Pokémon fur clinging to the bed!
a_sch_dorm04_05:
It’s a huge rack of computer stuff! What could
Penny be using all this for?
a_sch_dorm04_06: There’s a poster of Palafin, the Pelagic Protector!
a_w23_01:
There’s some sort of plate inscribed with a
mysterious symbol...
